Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bug with Open XML SDK adding 3D model" (#1280) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
You can no longer add 3D model to PowerPoint in verion 2.19.0

**To Reproduce**
up to version 2.18.0 you can use the following code to add 3D model to your PowerPoint

private static readonly string MODEL_3D_URI = "http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/drawing/2017/model3d";
 OpenXmlUnknownElement unknowElement = new OpenXmlUnknownElement( prefix: "am3d", localName: "model3d", namespaceUri: MODEL_3D_URI );
            OpenXmlAttribute attribute = new OpenXmlAttribute( prefix: "r", localName: "embed", namespaceUri: RELS_URI, value: modelId );
            unknowElement.SetAttribute( attribute );

Now the 3D part generated with this code is empty.


**Observed behavior**
3D model container is empty

**Expected behavior**
3D model container should have the 3D part in it

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS:  Windows 11
 - Office version 18.2210.1203.0
 - .NET Target:  .NET Framework
 - DocumentFormat.OpenXml Version: 2.19.0

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "changed HightScale to HeightScale" (#1444) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody: this was a typo in our backend generation.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Bug with Open XML SDK" (#1443) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Opened issue "Update OpenXML MS documentation" (#1442) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
After this commit a number of APIs were removed:
https://github.com/dotnet/Open-XML-SDK/commit/4260711d6234f078b24c26d26eb17205532901d5
For example
`GetPartsCountOfType` was removed but the documentation doesn't indicated deprectated or removed in the applies to section.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/documentformat.openxml.packaging.openxmlpartcontainer.getpartscountoftype?view=openxml-2.8.1

infact the documentation hasn't been updated since 2.8.1 and these apis lived on through 2.20.0
https://github.com/dotnet/Open-XML-SDK/compare/v2.20.0...v3.0.0-beta1.patch

This is particularly unpleasant because the example code in the documentation is also incorrect: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/office/open-xml/how-to-insert-a-comment-into-a-word-processing-document

It does appear the documentation is hosted on github. Can please update the documentation? While I muddled through, porting my app to the latest sdk, It would be good for future users of the sdk to have a single source of truth.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "HightScale is misspelled in PropertySet.HightScale" (#1441) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
**Describe the bug**
The PropertySet.HightScale means `Specifies the amount that the height has been scaled by.`. 

The HightScale is misspelled. And I think it should be `HeightScale`.

Document: https://learn.microsoft.com/zh-cn/dotnet/api/documentformat.openxml.drawing.diagrams.propertyset.hightscale

**Screenshots**
None.

**To Reproduce**
None.



**Observed behavior**
None.

**Expected behavior**
None.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
None.

**Additional context**
